title: baiters/advance_fee/sources/scamorama/lewes_lamido.html
notes: (A moment of editorial honesty: "Louise" did not include that fax. As an example of the type of thing she might have received, see the following, one of many Lamido-grams bouncing around the ether, extraneous elements removed. You know the drill.)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
April 27, 2006
 
The scammers fax 2 certificates to Bean Kounter.
 
One certificate certifies "that the sum of US$15,000,000 Approved by the FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF NIGERIA belonging to MR. BEAN KOUNTER OF UNITED STATES OF AMERICA has been declared free from anything to do with Terrorist Activities.
Beneficiary MR. BEAN KOUNTER is free to receive his payment from Standard Trust Security Company London.
This Certificate confirms all the rights and obligation such as award of contracts, execution of contracts, claim of credits and international inheritance payment regulations in accordance to the provisions of act 54 section 9 of Foreign Payment Amendment bill of 2002.
Under the United Nations Security Service Act on Transfer / Receive of Funds."
This certificate is signed by STATE SECURITY SERVICES DIRECTOR and FINANCE ADMINITRATIVE (misspelled).
 
The second certificate is a Federal Government of Nigeria Tax Clearance Certificate certifying that Bean Kounter has paid income tax "on inheritance fund with the Federal Republic of Nigeria" in the amount of US$35,000, for "three years non-resident tax clearance 2004 Ð 2006"
This certificate is signed by "Officer in charge AREA OFFICE/STATION"

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

April 28, 2006
 
Bean Kounter receives a fax from sheijackson54@yahoo.com, that is supposedly from the OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT, White House, Washington D. C
 
Here is the text of the fax:

ATTN: Bean Kounter
SIR 04/27/06
During the recent G8 (Summits) held in Sea Island, the president of Nigeria Ð Chief Olusegun Obasanjo made a request to obtain a One Billion Dollar (US$1Billion) Loan to offset the debt owed its foreign contractors. The White House had resolved with the Nigerian government that they would support them to plead with World bank for the loan of US$1Billion.
OUR MISSION: We have agreed to work assiduously with some agencies and representatives of the Nigerian government in dissolving this Economic Impasse. We are to carry out from records made available to us, Attestation, vetting Reconciliation and direct payment of genuinely cleared contract payment claim a contained in contract award files handed over to us. We are not unmindful of the frivolous and fraudulent machinations of people and agents of government trusted with state responsibility through diversion of Money meant for contract payment and outright denial of payment to contractors on the premise of fabricated reasons as reported on our bulletin of Dec. 17, 2005.
One of the conditions for the granting of such loan to Nigerian Government is a direct involvement of World bank officials for efficient handling of these contract payment by World bank personnel's, which the government of Nigeria consented to. The World bank has finally granted the request of the people and government of the Federal Republic of Nigeria to mediate in the age long impasse of payment of all outstanding contract payment inherited from the deposed Military government till date.
In Lieu of the aforementioned, we write to notify you that you can make a claim on your contract payment now from Nigerian Government but due to the numerous fraudulent activities occurring in Nigeria, whereby contractor's fund are being diverted by bank officials and illegal fees are imposed on contractor's in order frustrate genuine contractors from receiving their contract entitlement, you are advised to contact DR SULE LA MIDO, whom is a Diplomat and also Minister for Foreign Affairs in Nigeria for further directives on your payment and he will be leaving traveling to LONDON for the realize of your payment which can be paid to you upon his arrival in LONDON to avoid being a victim to these numerous fraudster claiming to be in position of paying beneficiaries.
 
In the spirit of been our brothers keeper, you are advised to contact DR SULE LAMIDO on his Email address: minister_foreign_affairsdept@yahoo.com for further assistance and legal advises on whom to deal with in the office in Nigeria. If you are already dealing with any officials/offices in Nigeria, you also advise to contact him so as to verify if the person(s) or office(s) you are dealing with are genuine government officials because a lot of people has fallen victim to these gang of fraudster.
Thanks for your understanding.

messages.body:
Dear Dr. Lamido
Could you please explain what this contract is all about? Your fax did not come through clearly, so I could not read most of it.
I am assuming it has something to do with my late husband's business. I know he was involved in some projects in Africa, but I was not aware that he had any business dealings in your country.
Since my husband died in a ghastly car accident on Interstate Route 80 I have been trying to sort out his business dealings. This is driving me crazy. Any help you can provide would be greatly appreciated.
Yours truly,
Louise Lewes
206-202-xxxx Phone & Fax

messages.body:
November 3, 2005
Permit me to introduce myself. My name is Bean Kounter. I was employed by the late Mr. Lewes as chief accountant for his business enterprises. I am also the accountant for the Lewes family and executor of the estate of Mr. Lewes.
Louise Lewes has asked me to intercede for her with you in the matter of the contract payment. She has forwarded a copy of your E-Mail correspondence with Mrs. Lewes, which I have thoroughly reviewed.
We wish to avoid the exhorbitant tax consequences that would occur if we received payment in the United States, not to mention almost certain raised eyelashes over the substandard amount of money involuted.
Therefore I propose that we meet in Nigeria for the dispossession of funds, after which I can arrange to forward the monies to a bank account in a safe tax heaven.
I could meet with you in about two weeks, if all the modalities are in place on your end.
Please advice.
Bean Kounter

messages.body:
November 12, 2005
I am going to confide in you, but please don't breathe a word of this to any one.
The company owned by the late Mr. Lewes is under investigation for illegal arms sales to Syria.
Mr. Lewes was ordered to appear before a Federal Grand Jury to answer questions related to said arms sales. Before his scheduled Grand Jury appearance, Mr. Lewes was killed in a tragic car accident. The Federal Bureau of Investigation was called in, and they now suspect that Mr. Lewes was murdered, and that the car accident was rigged to conceal his murder.
Because of this cloud hanging over Mr. Lewes and his company, it is impossible for me to take possession of the funds in the United States or in London. The money would be immediately confisticated by the FBI. My only hope is to take possession in Nigeria, where I have contacts who can help me to move the funds to a safe haven.
That is why I want to meet with you in Nigeria, to set up the transfer. I can provide you with whatever monies you will need to expedite the transfer. I realize that there may be some officials that you may have to bribe to look the other way, and that there may be additional costs to secure the proper documentation.
 
Just let me know what you need, and I will make the funds available to you when we meet.
I am hoping to meet with you at your earliest convenience, hopefully within the next two to three weeks.
Please respond urgently.
Bean Kounter

Thanks for all your hard work on this project. You will be well rewarded.
Can you meet with me in Lagos on December 2? I will introduce you to my contact at the Union bank of Nigeria, who will assist us in the transfer of the fund.
I would like to converse with you, but I fear that my telephone calls are being monitored by the authorities. So we will have to continue to communicate via E-Mail.
Mrs. Lewes has suffered a complete nervous breakdown; she is undergoing treatment at a psychiatric facility. She has been sending E-Mail messages which are complete gibberish. If you get one of her messages, please ignore it. Pray for her recovery, my Brother, she is a good woman who is surfering emotionally at the tragic death of her husband.
God Bless!
Bean Kounter

messages.body:
November 18, 2005
Look, Brother, we are wasting a lot of time here. As long as the fund is safely secured for now, then we can meet and plan for the transfer. I have not made a final decision on that yet. Maybe Dubai, maybe the Bahamas, I don't know. Maybe transfer in one lump sum, maybe in bits and pieces. I can work out the details with you when we meet.
I am having second thoughts about using my contact at the Union bank. I may be leaving myself open to blackmail.
Since you seem to be unable to tell me how much money you need, then I will make the decision for you. I will arrange to provide you with $22,500 when we meet. I think that should be more than enough to offset your expenses for lawyer's fees and documentation. But I want it understood that the expenses will be deducted before we each get our share.
NOW, I NEED YOU TO GET BACK TO ME ON THIS!! THIS IS IMPORTANT. I WANT TO MEET WITH YOU IN LAGOS ON DECEMBER 2. I HAVE OTHER BUSINESS THAT I MUST TAKE CARE OF IN ABUJA, SO I NEED TO FINALIZE MY PLANS.
DECEMBER 2!! DECEMBER 2!! THAT IS THE TARGET DATE. dO YOU UNDERSTAND?
GET BACK TO ME URGENTLY.
I have attached my picture so you can recognize me at the airport.

Bean Kounter

messages.body:
November 24, 2005
 
 
What is going on?
Why haven't I heard from you?
Your intransigence has caused me to alter my plans. I will not be able to meet with you until December 8. I will send you my flight plan shortly. I expect you to meet me at the airport in Lagos.
If you don't show up I will proceed to Abuja to conclude my other business. I will then return to the US and I will refer this matter to my contact at the Union bank for resolution.
And now I receive the following E-Mail from the Minister for Finance. Do you know anything about this?
Happy Thanksgiving
Bean Kounter

messages.subject: From : The Desk of Minister for Finance
messages.body:
From The Desk of Minister for Finance
Dr Mrs Lolita
 
Sir/ Madam
 
Your file was brought to my office before the closing of work on friday and due to the stress you must have undergo with what I read in your file I realize that , I need to give your case an urgent attention .
 
I have taken note of lot of stresses your husband passed through before his death in the respect of receiving this fund .($30million)
 
It also clear to me that you have been dealing with so many impostures/ fraudsters who uses the name of official to contact you just to make sure that they collect money from you and at the end there will be no result .
I urgently advise you to stop every other communication from this moment on because I have take up your case and I will make sure that you receive your payment without any further delay .
 
Once again I will advise you to stop given people your personal / banking information because they may use it to defraud you .
 
What I really need to confirm from you is the name of the bank you want your payment to be transfer to because what I am having in your file is about 5 different bank names and I don't know which once exactly , you will like your payment to be transfer to .
 
Kindly confirm this to me before the closing of work today to enable me take the next step .
 
REGARDS
 
Dr Mrs Lolita
Minister for Finance

messages.body:
December 3, 2005
I have been instructed to contact you by Dr. Sule Lamido (the honorable Minister for Foreign Affairs of Nigeria) in respect of your outstanding contract payment. I have also been informed about your pending trip to Lagos to attend to the matter. However, much as we remain comforted to know that you will be in Lagos on the 8th Dec. 2005, it has been brought to my knowledge in view of the discovered documentary discrepancies recorded in your file that, it will not be in your interest to transact your matter in Lagos. Although we remain willing to proceed with you on the status-quo terms, unfortunately, upon thorough examination of records it was discovered that your payment was among the list of foreign contract payments recently suspended by order of the Controller and Accountant General Dept. of Federal Ministry of Finance (Presidency). This was to enable the CAGD to investigate and determine the authenticity and existence of such companies and their financial claims. The suspension was also to help establish whether the companies had indeed executed such contracts and services for the listed government ministries and agencies (especially the Nigeria National Petroleum Corporation and other prime parastatals) for which the CBN had to effect transfers. This situation was prompted by the recent revelations by the CBN on the fraudulent activities of some government officials in collaboration with the payroll processing unit of CBN who engage in illegal foreign transfers to the accounts owned by such fraudulent Companies. To this extent, we have re-arrived on definite details towards successful accomplishment of your matter without procedural bottlenecks and upfront financial commitment. The new procedure as instructed by Hon. Dr. Sule Lamido involves an arrangement whereby your funds will be released in cash money from Federal Government of Nigeria special tender funds meant for settlement of International depts. of the West Africa Gas Pipeline Co. in Accra Ghana. By the prevailing arrangement, you will have to come to Ghana to attend to the expected banking proceedings. You will be expected to open a non-resident account with Standard Chartered bank Accra where the cash money will be deposited upon release by the International Payment Office of WAGPC.. There is an existing agreement between CBN and SCB for accommodation of such cash payments and ensure its injection into the financial system for subsequent outflow on bank to bank basis. The documentary insufficiency to authenticate your beneficiary claims will be taken care of by the content of the agreement between CBN and SCB and we intend to exploit these payment clauses in your case. Your stay in Ghana will be for 2 days only and the Honorable Minister has already resolved to be sincerely helpful in your payment course. It will not be in our interest for you to embark on a fruitless payment journey to Lagos for your payment since there is lack of sufficient beneficiary documentation to support the payment in your favour. I will herewith suggest that you re-schedule your flight to Accra on the same date of your expected arrival in Lagos. In the meantime I will wait to receive your response before deciding to accredit your payment among the listed transfers scheduled through this privileged source of CBN contract debt settlement. We look forward to receiving from you.
Best REGARDS
Shola Rhodes

messages.subject: Vital Mail
messages.body:
January 17, 2006
Rhodes & Rhodes Associates
Your emails have been forwarded for my appraisal and subsequent response to issues in the mails. The contents were however received with surprise and mixed feelings and I find it inexplicably ridiculous of your mail positions. I had in the past days pleaded that it would be very necessary to at least engage each other on telephone conversation and requested that Mr. Bean Kounter should endeavour to contact me on telephone 00233244935398. I have been trying the number given by Mr. Kounter and surprisingly, it was always on voice mail. Your actions has made me to feel skeptical on your genuineness and to doubt your sincerity of purpose otherwise, why has Mr. Kounter not bothered to either respond to my mails or provide telephone convenience for voice talk, yet he expects me to meet him carrying the Jumbo sign depicting Mr. Bean Kounter (the ghost ?). Please let us do things with much more business decorum instead of some one trying to hide behind his colours. I will be ready to receive Mr. Kounter at the Airport even without the "name sign" since I have goodwill contacts at the Immigration Desk of the Kotoka International Airport Accra. However, I must receive even a single line of mail or few minutes telephone call as I receive calls from round the world and your own part of the world must not be an exception. Please my friends let us work as partners in business instead of playing hide and seek game.

messages.body:
January 17, 2006
Hello, Mr. Shola Rhodes and Dr. sule.
I am sorry I ever agreed to be an emergency contact between you and Mr. Kounter.
I was just doing Mr. Kounter a favor; I had no idea it would get so involved. I am not going to try to call you, because I am still confused over the number, whether it has oo233 or 009233 or whatever.
You can call me if you want, but I have no new informations to give you, other than what you see here. If you want to call me, you can reach me at 206-888-xxxx, and if I don't pick up, leave me a message.
I don't know what your business is with Mr. Kounter, but I guess it must be pretty important, because he told me he rescheduled all his meetings with his clients so he could meet with you.
Mr. Kounter left me a voice mail to tell me that he has arrived in Frankfurt. He said he was very tired and needed to get some sleep before tomorrow's flight to Ghana.
I have a question for you, Mr. Rhodes. If you don't hold up a sign with Mr. Kounter's name, how is he going to find you at the airport?
The flight departs from Frankfurt at about 5AM tomorrow morning, my time, and I will be asleep at that time. So this is probably the last E-Mail you will receive from me, before your meeting with Mr. Kounter.
Good luck to the both of you. And you too, Dr.
Jym Dandi

My dear friend,
Thanks for your massage; it is a shock new to hear this, but all the same business will continue, what I need from you now is you international passport, postal address and your private phone and fax number so I can know who I am dealing with.
Mr. James, what I am doing with Mr. Bean is about money transfer and the amount involved is $15.5 million which is not a small money, now that you said that this man has been arrested this fund can not be laying low until he comes out, as you said that you will be of help, it will be now a bank to bank transfer than coming down to African, what I need from you now is your bank details for a change of beneficiary.
Mr. James are you sure you can handle this transaction? The fund will be shared fifty fifty when it gets into you Account, and also bear in mind that this deal will cost us a little charges for the change of Account and beneficiary name.
I wait to see how capable you are to handle this deal.

messages.subject: YOU DO NOT HAVE ANYTHING TO BE AFRAID OF.
messages.body:
January 31, 2006
My dear friend,
I got your mail; due to your delays in replying my mail I thought you where no longer interested.
But frankly I will tell you the honest true about how this money came, we awarded a contract to a GERMAN company that help us to bring some pumping matching which we sullied to our rural arrears where there is no pipe born water.
In that case I and the minister of rural development Union collided to influence the bill from the normal amount they where supposed to receive.
This contract has been executed since two years ago and the money has been in the Account without any one coming to collect it, so I decided to contact Mr. Bean Kounter to help me secure this money in his account, even I have changed all the approval papers to his name to enable him receive this money from our corresponding bank, but due to his problem I don't think that I can wait for him to come out before I conclude this deal, I have to move on, so I don't know if you can assist me. You do have anything to be afraid of, the deal is risk free.
You do not need to tell me not to let Mr. Kounter know that you have talking to me, because he is the one that has been delaying this deal, he has given me several appointments and he always failed, I will not let him know anything about this deal again.
I have worked for our Government for about thirty years and I do not have anything to account for that is why I decided to do this so that I will have something to use in taking care of my family when I will retied from the office.
I hope you understand my situation.
I wait to hear from you.

messages.body:
February 4, 2006
My Dearest Dr. Sule,
It is such a joy to hear your good wishes for my health.
I am starting a new life, Dr. Sule. I decided that I must get away from all the bad memories around here. So I have sold my home, and purchased a motor home. I will be leaving very shortly, and traveling around the country, visiting some of my favorite National Parks.
As for the fund, here is what I would like:
I would like to establish a life endowment with the Reverend Quentin Klucks at the Church of the Eternal Light. Reverend Klucks will use some of the money to rebuild the Church, which was completely destroyed by fire last year. Unfortunately there was no insurance on the property.
This arrangement will provide me with a substantial annual income for the rest of my life. And because of the charitable donation inherent in this scheme, my income taxes will be minimized.
Reverend Klucks will provide an account for the transfer. He will certainly contact you by the early part of next week.
I must add a word of caution about Reverend Klucks. He founded the Church of the Eternal Light and immediately attracted a strong following. He is passionate about his religion, and extremely devoted to his congregation. Everyone loves him. But he has had very little formal schooling, so there will probably be a lot of misspellings and bad grammar in his E-Mails.
I'm sure that in a very short time you and Reverend Klucks will become good friends.
All my Love, Dearest Dr. Sule, and wish me a safe trip.
Louise Lewes

I got the Church Council of Elders and Youngers to meet last night to git there aprovel for the $10,850 what you said you gonna need for the transfere. and they aksed me a lot of questions, which I ansered as best I could. It is with a hevvy hart that I be ritin this to you, on account I reelize you havin been involvered with a big deal with Mrs. Louise Lewes, who is the wife of the late Hugh Lewes.
Anyways, here it goes:
I be at my day job last week as a greeter at the Walmart one day, when who walks in but Mr. Bean Kounter, which maybe you don't know was put in jail for the murder of the late Hugh Lewes, but the jury said not gilty, so they let him go. So Mr. Bean Kounter aks me witch way is the Luggage Deportment, on account he needs to buy a new suitcase for a trip to London. So as I points him in the rite direckshun.
Then woe is me, about 10 minits later, Mrs. Louise Lewes comes into the Walmart, she bein back from her road trip. She says she gonna be makin a trip to London, and she wants to know if Walmart sells some speshul razer to shave her ****.
I tells Mrs. Lewes I ain't never heerd about any such razer, and then I tells Mrs. Lewes that Mr. Bean Kounter jest came in to the Walmart to buy a suitcase, and he be goin to London, too.
And now, Dr. Sule, I be so sorry fer what I said, on account Mrs. Lewes gets real egsited, her thinkin Mr. Kounter was in jail fer killin her husband, the late Hugh Lewes, and not knowin that the jury said not gilty. Mrs. Lewes goes runnin off to look fer Mr. Kounter. And from what they say, when Mrs. Lewes finds Mr. Kounter she calls him all kindsa names fer killin her late husband, Hugh Lewes.
Then, God fergive us, Dr. Sule, Mrs. Lewes pulls out a gun and shoots Mr. Bean Kounter in the head. I go runnin over when I hears the gunshot, and I aks Mrs. Lewes to give me the gun. She says " I have avenged the death of poor Hugh". Then she says what sounds like this, "My Back Man don't love me", whatever that means don't nobody know, and then she says "I go now to meet my late husband in Hevvin". And then she puts the gun to her head, and shoots herself dead.
Now we got 2 peeples dead, and what a waist.
So be it, Dr. Sule. And now please join me in prayer fer our dear departed Louise Lewes, and Bean Kounter, and oh yeah, Hugh Lewes too.
Here goes:
Our father, witch art in Hevvin, Harold be thy name.
Thy Kingdom comes, thy will be done on earth as it is in hevvin.
Give us this day our jelly bread, and lead us not into Penn Station, but deliver us from evil fraud stars.
AMEN
 
GRANDIOSA MAMMARIA STUPENDULOSA EST.
Reverend Quentin Klucks
messages.raw:

Reverend Quentin Klucks
